_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:05:04 using v2.0
title: How have NHS staff numbers changed by staff type?
analysis_commentary: The total numbers of all NHS staff has been increasing since 2002, though the increases are greater for some staff groups. The number of qualified nursing staff increased less than the other staff groups and seems to have stabilised since 2009. In contrast to this, the number of doctors has been steadily increasing every year and has increased by over 40% since 2002; compared to a 14% increase in nursing staff.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
